article:
Events and trends *Carthage conquers Sicily, Sardinia and Corsica. *559 BCâKing
Cambyses I of Anshan dies and is succeeded by his son Cyrus II the Great. *558
BCâHegesias is removed as Archon of Athens. *558 BCâThe Chinese state of Jin
defeats its rival Qin in battle. *556 BCâPisistratus is exiled from Athens to
Euboea. *556 BCâLabashi-Marduk succeeds Neriglissar as king of Babylon. *556
BCâNabonidus succeeds Labashi-Marduk as king of Babylon. *c. 550 BCâColonisation
of Greeks ends. *550 BCâAbdera is destroyed by the Thracians. *550 BCâThe Temple
of Artemis completed in Ephesus. *550 BCâCyrus II the Great overthrows Astyages
of the Medes, establishing the Persian Empire. *c. 550 BCâTemple of Hera I,
Paestum, Italy, is built. *550 BCâSiddhartha Gautama founded Buddhism in
Northern India after achieving enlightenment after six years of practicing
penance and meditation.

Significant people *556 BC â Rule of Labashi-Marduk as king of Babylon *556 BC â
Rule of Nabonidus as king of Babylon *558 BCâDeath of Solon, Athenian,
Statesman, Poet. *c. 556 BCâBirth of Simonides of Ceos. *555 BCâDeath of
Stesichorus, Greek lyric poet.. *September 28, 551 BCâBirth of Confucius,
philosopher (traditional date). *c. 551 BCâCommonly accepted date of the Death
of Zoroaster, Founder of Zoroastrianism. *550 BCâBirth of Epicharmus, Greek poet
(d. 460 BC).
